results.headline: In the Soup (Movie)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of In the Soup

results.summary_short: Would-be New York filmmaker. Wild, funny, clever caper, and Cassel's gangster is hilarious.

results.headline: HYENAS (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hyenas

results.summary_short: Senegalese version of Duerrenmatt's ``Visitor,'' in which a rich woman promises wealth to her impoverished town if her ex-lover is executed. Pungent.

results.headline: STORY OF QIU JU, THE (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Story of Qiu Ju

results.summary_short: Farm wife's search for justice. Remarkable drama, via Zhang Yimou.

results.headline: OF MICE AND MEN (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Of Mice and Men

results.summary_short: Steinbeck's Depression-era migrant workers. Gripping, haunting, but the darker 1940 version has the edge.

results.headline: MR BASEBALL (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mr. Baseball

results.summary_short: Big Tom at the bat in Japan. Light, often ruefully funny caper, with a genial, satisfying Selleck.

results.headline: MIGHTY DUCKS, THE (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Mighty Ducks

results.summary_short: Reluctant coach of hockey rowdies. ''Bad News Bears'' spinoff with no personality of its own.

results.summary_short: On giving and taking credit. Big, expensive-looking, harmless comedy. Hoffman makes it work.

results.headline: DOUBLE EDGE (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Double Edge

results.summary_short: Flawed by compelling mix of strife-torn Palestine fiction and fact (interviews), shot during Persian Gulf war. Best for sharp you- are-there ambience.
